comments.body: @goderbauer - looking at this, I would have thought I'd have to reset this at the end of the test.  Are we missing a check for that, or does this just not need to be reset?
Not resetting it is a problem - filed https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/30897
Should we also assert that the children are in the right position after the re-arrange?
Out of curiousity, why not just use `tester.drag`?
Can you add one of those issue references in case it gets lost in history?
does this fail when you don't include the change to sliver_grid.dart?

@Hixie Yes, it will throw exception in master branch:

```
Running "flutter pub get" in flutter...                             1.8s

'childMainAxisExtent != null && childMainAxisExtent >= 0': is not true.

Either the assertion indicates an error in the framework itself, or we should provide substantially
more information in this error message to help you determine and fix the underlying cause.
In either case, please report this assertion by filing a bug on GitHub:
  https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/new?template=BUG.md
```
